question:
Avataran was a key feature of the 2016-17 railway budget. The activities under it were hit by slow supply from SAIL recently. Which of the following statements about the program are correct?
  1. It consists of 7 mission activities that was proposed to change Indian Railways.
  2. Mission 25 tonnes seeks to increase the average speed of freight trains.
  3. Mission zero accidents was intended for elimination unmanned level crossing.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Avataran consists of 7 missions: Mission 25 tonnes, Mission hundred, Mission PACE, Mission zero accidents, Mission beyond book keeping, Mission capacity utilisation and Mission Raftaar. Each mission will deal with improving a specific component of the railways over a decadeâ€™s period. Statement 2 is incorrect: Mission 25 tonnes seeks to increase the carrying capacity using 25 tonnes axle load wagons. This will be implemented for 10 to 20% freight loading and will target 70% of freight traffic. This project has been one of the worst hit by delayed supply from SAIL. Steel Authority of India Limited is the second largest producer of Steel in India. Statement 3 is correct: Mission zero accident had 2 goals: use of TCAS and elimination of unmanned level crossings in India. TCAS is Train Collision Avoidance System. It is an indigenous technology that will prevent head on collisions. Rashtriya Rail Sanraksha Kosh was fund announced in 2017-18 for helping with safety related works in the railways.
